turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: I don't like this, this...

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Why don't you shut up, Professor? Just relax.

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: I think she's starting to suspect something?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Oh, my God. It happened right here. She came home. She saw them.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Saw who?!

turns.speaker: CINDY
turns.text: Don't touch me!!

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: I finished all the interviews.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Let me see the files.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: They're on top of the bookshelf. I'll get them.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Let me help you.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: I don't need your help. I'm perfectly capable.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Here you go, Professor.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Are these all the subjects?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Yes. The scored all over the Kiersey Temperament Sorter just like you asked for.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Any of them hot?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: I also took the liberty of putting those with near-death experiences on top.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Good thinking, Dwight. Traumatized co-eds are a sure thing.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: As I am sure you are aware, Professor, subjects who are close to death are statistically more likely to have the suggestibility required for paranormal investigation, which is, of course, why I've given them special consideration.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Look, whatever you say, kid, but the more they're hurtin', the more they need a squirtin', if you know what I mean.  Ooh, I like her.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Cindy Campbell. Classic abandoned personality disorder. She seems guarded, but willing to do this.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Willing? I like that.  And, this one?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: That's Ray Williams. I couldn't quite figure him out, but he seemed very eager and excited when we met.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Car accident, gun shot, multiple stabbings, a hook through the back... Where did you find these kids?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: They are the survivors of the Steveston County massacre.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Fantastic. These kids are exactly the kind of catalyst needed to awaken Hell House.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: How are we going to get them all up there?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: I'll make it part of the class. We'll tell them they're participating in a study on sleep disorders.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: And what happens when all hell breaks loose?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: We record and document it. We're gonna make history, Dwight. The first documented, unrefuted evidence of life after death. The book sales alone will be worth millions. I'll be rich, and you my friend, will have one hell of a thesis paper. Now, what time is orientation?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: In about fifteen minutes.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Remember, Dwight, not a word to anyone.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: I have taken care of everything, including medical supplies and blood storage. We want to be safe.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Right. What about condoms?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Professor!

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Hey, you're the one who brought up safety. I'm perfectly willing to go in raw.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Would you please focus?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Fine.  What's all this stuff?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Well, this measures the amount of thermal imbalance within a room down to the tiniest molecular disturbances.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Are those cameras all throughout the house?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Yes, I thought that it would be best.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Even in the bathroom?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: So, if one of our little chickadees is taking a shower which one of these buttons do I press to get a close- up?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: That one.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: After dinner, you and I will take shifts throughout the night. I don't want to chance miss anything.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: I'm going to change for dinner. I'll see you shortly.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Sounds good. I'm just going to run up to my room. Hop in the shower. Jump into my jogging suit, and I'll be right there.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Not to worry. There's been no reported activity in the house for over twenty years.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Let's not forget, folks, this is a study on sleep disorders.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Ah, yes, which reminds me, who here thinks they'd wake up if somebody snuck into their room and started sniffing between their legs?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: My God! Is she dead?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: No, they're just powder burns, thank God. They were empty. Get her upstairs.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Professor, I think you should see this.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: What is it? Some tits? A beaver shot? What?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: No, these are the tapes from the living room. Check this out.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: The image there.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Are you sure it's not the tape?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: I don't think so. It's on all the cameras, and check this out. The thermal readings inside the house dropped ten degrees when the image was recorded.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Congratulations, Dwight, it's begun.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: What the hell?!

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: It's not what is looks like. She's having a breakdown. Help me get her to her room.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Professor, we need to talk.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: What is it, Dwight?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: I think we should consider cutting the experiment short.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: The force in this house is far greater than I anticipated. In one night I recorded cold spots, shifting magnetic fields, the E.U.P. is picking up white sounds everywhere.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: That's why we came here, remember?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Yes, but I've seen the tapes. This poltergeist is becoming increasingly more violent. We all could be in danger. I say we pull the plug.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Whoa, Dwight, I say when we pull the plug. Get a hold of yourself. Dwight, we're on the verge of greatness and I'm about this close to getting laid. Now, the bus will be here on Monday. Until then no one leaves.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: I can do it myself.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR
turns.text: Yeah, I can see that. Later I want you to teach me that trick, but right now we have a job to do.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: The keys. She took the keys.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Hello Dwight.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What are you working on?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Just a little experiment.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Work, work, work. Is that all that you do?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Well, there's a lot riding on this project.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: The Professor might have everyone else fooled, but I know who the real brains of the operation is.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: You do.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: That's what turns me on about you, Dwight. You're so smart.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: And sexy.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Of course. So sexy.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Ooh, you hair is so soft and silky. What do you use on it?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Just a little Rogaine.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You know, Dwight, I hear you're the only one who has the key to the gate.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What if I wanted to borrow those keys?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Oh, I couldn't do that.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: She's right. We should stick together.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Alright. Come on, you guys.

turns.speaker: HANSON
turns.text: Excuse me, sir, but the students have started to arrive. Dinner will be ready shortly.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Thanks, handyman.

turns.speaker: HANSON
turns.text: I'm the caretaker, not the handyman.  Nice skates. Be careful. You don't want to fall and break something.

turns.speaker: HANSON
turns.text: Who's first? Anyone like a wing?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Yours, or the turkeys?

turns.speaker: HANSON
turns.text: I supposed you'd like a leg. How about two?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: That's it. I'm gonna put my food in your ass. I should warn you, I'm a black belt in karate.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: It's the best seat in the house. I warmed it up for you.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Second best.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You never could feel your legs.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: What do you know about it?!... Listen, the ghost is too powerful. The only chance we have is to use this machine.  I need you to go get the others and meet us upstairs.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Alright... I might need your help.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: My help?

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: A little bit... Give me your belt.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'm not even wearing any drawers. Forget about a belt.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Okay, give me my belt.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You're not wearing a belt.

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: Alright, go to the belt store...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: You mean to tell me we're dead!

turns.speaker: DWIGHT
turns.text: I guess so.

turns.speaker: FATHER MCFEELY
turns.text: Uh... I'm Father McFeely

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: Father, come in, please.

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: I'm so glad you're here.

turns.speaker: FATHER MCFEELY
turns.text: I came as fast as I could, but at my age the little soldier needs a lot more thumpin before it starts pumpin. If I tickle my ass before...

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: It's okay. I understand.

turns.speaker: FATHER MCFEELY
turns.text: How is she?

turns.speaker: MOTHER
turns.text: She's gotten worse, Father. She won't eat, she won't talk. The child won't even let me touch her.

turns.speaker: FATHER MCFEELY
turns.text: Yes... Sometimes you have to give them candy.

turns.speaker: HARRIS
turns.text: Father.

turns.speaker: FATHER MCFEELY
turns.text: Not unless you have a paternity test to prove it.

turns.speaker: HARRIS
turns.text: Would you like to see the girl?

turns.speaker: FATHER MCFEELY
turns.text: Soon. First, I must bless this house.

turns.speaker: HARRIS
turns.text: Father, are you okay?

turns.speaker: FATHER MCFEELY
turns.text: Yeah, but you might wanna light a match before you go in there.  Did you bring my bag?

turns.speaker: HARRIS
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: FATHER MCFEELY
turns.text: Then let us prepare.

turns.speaker: FATHER MCFEELY
turns.text: Remember, don't ask her too many questions.

turns.speaker: HARRIS
turns.text: Because she will lie?

turns.speaker: FATHER MCFEELY
turns.text: No, because her breath smells like a horse's ass.

turns.speaker: FATHER MCFEELY
turns.text: Oh shit, you gonna take that?

turns.speaker: HARRIS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: FATHER MCFEELY
turns.text: What she said about your mother?

turns.speaker: HARRIS
turns.text: No thanks.

turns.speaker: FATHER MCFEELY
turns.text: My holy water.

turns.speaker: HARRIS
turns.text: Father, I think you should rest.

turns.speaker: FATHER MCFEELY
turns.text: No, I'm fine.

turns.speaker: HANSON
turns.text: Sit down and join us, Cindy.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Yeah, I always wanted to watch you eat.

turns.speaker: HANSON
turns.text: Now you're being rude, Shorty.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Washington is full of cornpone country pussy -- just ask Jesse Jackson.

turns.speaker: HANSON
turns.text: Yo son, check this out.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Dog, you look hot.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Sorry, y'all. My bad.

turns.speaker: HANSON
turns.text: Shorty, why don't you say grace?

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: Me? Grace? Okay -- Dear God --

turns.speaker: HANSON
turns.text: This part removes the sense of humor.

turns.speaker: SHORTY
turns.text: I am Tom Green, I am Tom Green. Daddy want some sausage, sausage. Daddy want some sausage...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I woke up naked, too.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Hey, dude, you got a tattoo.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: What does it say?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: It says, "Ray."

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Sweet. Hey, you got a tattoo, too.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Get out?! What does it say?

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: "Fucked me."

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Aww. Cool. Dude.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: "Ray!"

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: "Fucked me."

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: "Ray!"

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: "Fucked me."

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Yo' Tommy, what up, man?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: I'm totally freakin' dude. I keep having these nightmares, then I wake up screaming with these awful back spasms. I can't take it anymore, man.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Aww, man. You just need to chill out. Come on, there's this party tonight it's gonna be fun. Lot's of alcohol and honeys.

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Alright, but I ain't drinking. and you're gonna have to look after me.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Don't worry, I got your back.

turns.speaker: BIRDIE
turns.text: BLOOD FEAST!

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: The "Citizen Kane" of gore movies.

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Hi, Mom.

turns.speaker: BIRDIE
turns.text: Hi, Mrs. Sutphin.

turns.speaker: BIRDIE
turns.text: Oh, boy!

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Mom, Mr. Stubbins is a nimrod!

turns.speaker: BIRDIE
turns.text: Bye, Mrs, Sutphin.

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Bye, bird-brain. See ya, Scotty.

turns.speaker: BIRDIE
turns.text: Did you hear?

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: BIRDIE
turns.text: This is so cool! It's just like a horror movie.

turns.speaker: BIRDIE
turns.text: What a bitch!

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: It's the influence of all those family films.  Right, Mom?  Hey, Mom??...

turns.speaker: BIRDIE
turns.text: Mrs. Sutphin?

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Mother?

turns.speaker: BIRDIE
turns.text: 0h, shit!

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: You don't think...

turns.speaker: BIRDIE
turns.text: She wouldn't...

turns.speaker: BIRDIE
turns.text: ...Jenner... Jenson, Emy Lou Jenson. 3511 Clark Avenue!

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: That's right up the street! Come on! Just in case!

turns.speaker: BIRDIE
turns.text: I saw blood! And it's brown! Not red like in horror movies, but brown!!

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Is MOM... in there?

turns.speaker: BIRDIE
turns.text: No!  It wasn't like gore movies at all!  IT WAS REAL!

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Bring her home... I guess.

turns.speaker: BIRDIE
turns.text: No more violence... No more violence...

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: I wouldn't give ya a nickel.

turns.speaker: MISTY
turns.text: Carl can't believe how much I make at swap meets.

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Here we go again.

turns.speaker: MISTY
turns.text: He's really cute!

turns.speaker: MISTY
turns.text: Hi!

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Jeeezzz!

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: I can't believe Mr. Stubbins is dead.

turns.speaker: MISTY
turns.text: You said you hated him.

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Well... he was an asshole... but he didn't deserve to die!

turns.speaker: MISTY
turns.text: I'm not kidding. Carl stood me up this morning and then he was murdered at the flea market....

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: MURDERED?!!

turns.speaker: MISTY
turns.text: Yes murdered! You said you hated your teacher yesterday and he was murdered too. I don't know... maybe Mom's nuts!

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: It's a cool idea, Misty! Let's make a gore movie about Mom! Better yet, a TV series!

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: How about Mrs. Ackerman? We both hate her!  Should she be the next victim?

turns.speaker: MISTY
turns.text: No! Stop it! It's not funny. Mom might do it!  Someone else might die.

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: DAD! YOU DON'T THINK SHE DID IT??!

turns.speaker: MISTY
turns.text: I DO! Mom's gone crazy!

turns.speaker: MISTY
turns.text: Turn right on Timonioum Road. Hurry, Dad!

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: If Mom's a psycho, Scotty will still be ok, won't he?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Just a little, please. Bad for the teeth.

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Always the dentist.

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: You'd probably date him!  He's cu-uuute! Hey, Dad, did you ever see "Henry, Portrait of a Serial Killer?"

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I certainly did not.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Well, your mother's going to PTA today.  We'll see what your teacher has to say.

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Aw, Mom! I hate Mr. Stubbins!

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: I'm Dr. Eugene Sutphin. What's the trouble, officer?

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Is there a killer loose?

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Carl's a jerk!

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: He certainly drives like a jerk.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: No comment!

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: "Serial Mom"?  WOW!

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Sorry, ma'am.

turns.speaker: MRS. JENSON
turns.text: Do you have the musical, "Annie"?

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Sure do. Did you bring back "Ghost Dad"?

turns.speaker: MRS. JENSON
turns.text: There you go. I love Bill Cosby pictures.

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Mrs. Jensen, I've told you. You have to rewind the tapes before returning them!

turns.speaker: MRS. JENSON
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Because it's the rules!

turns.speaker: MRS. JENSON
turns.text: I don't feel like rewinding it!

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: You see the sign! It's a dollar fine for not rewinding and this time I'm gonna charge you! $2.99 plus one dollar is $3.99!

turns.speaker: MRS. JENSON
turns.text: Keep the change, you son of a psycho!

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Cute is not enough, Misty. You know that.

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: She sure can pick 'em!

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Chip, honey?

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Thanks, Mom.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Oh God, really!  This is the limit!

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Let me see!

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: You kids. Now Birdie, I want you to have a cookie and then run along home.

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: But Mom, the video's not over.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: No "but mom" for you, young man. Mr. Stubbins seems to think these silly movies are interfering with your studies.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Bye, Birdie.  Chip, honey... I know it's hard being a teenager but I understand... I'm your mother and I love you.

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Oh Mom...

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Can we watch that scene again? You know, where he rips out her heart?  PLEEEASE?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Ladies and gentlemen, the perfect meatloaf!

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Looks good, Mom!

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: I'm happy too and we want you to be happy.

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: I'm so happy I could shit.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: CHIP! You know how much I hate the brown word!

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: CHIP!!

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: God, Mom!  What's the matter?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Time to get up, that's all. You'll be late for work.

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: You scared me.

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Tell me the truth, Mom! It's ok with me, really! Are you a serial killer?

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: Chip, the only cereal I know about is Rice Krispies.

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: In here, Mom...

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: But, Chip...

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Get in, Mom! I have to open.

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: This is so silly.

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Are you Chip Sutphin?

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: Hold on...  Yeah I am, but you'll have to speak to my agent...

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Your mom killed my brother!

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: That's cool... hey look, you're Carl's brother, right?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: I'm sorry he's dead, but... have you signed off yet?

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: You mean for TV or print?

turns.speaker: CHIP
turns.text: TV, man! Farrah Fawcett's interested in playing my mother!

turns.speaker: YOUNG MAN
turns.text: Farrah Fawcett?! Who's gonna play my brother? Is Jason Priestly available?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Detectives, what is this about?

turns.speaker: DET. MOORE
turns.text: I know this sounds weird, Mr. Sutphin, but the Department of Motor Vehicle's computer shows only one blue station wagon registered to a parent of any of Mr. Stubbins' pupils.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Surely you don't think Beverly was involved!

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: What is it, officers? My patient is waiting.

turns.speaker: DET. MOORE
turns.text: Dr. Sutphin is your wife a big reader?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Bird books mostly...

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: We hope so, son. And no matter what your mother is, we'll love her anyway.

turns.speaker: DET. MOORE
turns.text: Suspect's family is headed east on Calverton....

turns.speaker: MISTY
turns.text: He goes to college with me!

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Leave her alone, Chip.  I think it's great she has a new beau, Beverly.

turns.speaker: MISTY
turns.text: You've been working in that video shop too long.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: And all that gore better hadn't be interfering with your schoolwork.

turns.speaker: MISTY
turns.text: Carl makes me happy and that threatens this family, doesn't it?

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Doesn't threaten me, honey. I'm happy.

turns.speaker: MISTY
turns.text: I got somebody you could run over, Mother!

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Misty, that's a terrible thing to say!  Detectives, it's time for you to leave. My wife knows nothing about this terrible... accident.

turns.speaker: MISTY
turns.text: She's gonna kill Scotty!

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: BOTH OF YOU! GET IN THE CAR!

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Home Sweet Home! Everything's fine, kids!

turns.speaker: MISTY
turns.text: I can't believe I thought my own mother was a murderess!

turns.speaker: MISTY
turns.text: Hi, Hank.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: MISTY SUTPHIN, GET IN THIS CAR!!

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Look at this!  "Hillside Strangler gets his college degree in prison!"

turns.speaker: MOM
turns.text: That's nice.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Nice?! He should have been executed!
